item.title: Syllabus
item.dc:creator: template
item.content:encoded:
ENV432:IMPACTS

Objectives

Students will explore how Environmental Change Impacts Life.

Organization

The course will be taught in an open blended format that includes both online and face-to-face instruction. Students will be expected to document their learning experience by maintaining their own personal WordPress blog. All student blogs will be syndicated to common course blog. Students will be expected to take a leading role in documenting the in class discussions for external participants. Lectures, readings and activities will be distributed via the course blog, where students will be expected to review and complete all materials prior to coming to discuss the materials in class. Special Google Hangouts On Air will be scheduled throughout the semester for students to have the opportunity to videoconference with Guest Speakers from around the world. Hangout sessions will be scheduled during class times and students are expected to participate. Open participants will be encouraged to join into the conversations on the hangout and via the backchannel by tweeting using the hashtag: #XXXX

Grades

All graded assignments and progress grades will be distributed privately to each student via the secure campus learning management system at http://learn.stateu.org or communicated directly to the student via campus email or on person.

Grading

Blog: 200 Final Exam: 100 Literature Review: 100 Research Proposal: 100 Progress Report Blog: 100 Final Paper: 100 Student-led Discussion: 100 Online Community Engagement: 100 In Class Participation: 100 Total: 1000 points

Course Schedule

This course is 15 weeks long; we will focus on each unit for 3 weeks. For each unit class meeting will follow the following format: Week 1 presentations & discussions lead by instructors & invited guests. Week 2 discussions, projects, activities Week 3 student led discussion and presentation

Course Outline

Unit 01 Title

XXXX Lecture Materials

Unit 02 Title

XXXX Lecture Materials

Unit 03 Title

XXXX Lecture Materials

Unit 04 Title

XXXX Lecture Materials

Unit 05 Title

XXXX Lecture Materials

item.title: Join Us!
item.dc:creator: template
item.content:encoded:
Learn XXXX, Join Us!

Follow along online and learn with us.

Are you interested in learning about XXXX? Great, Youre In! Follow along with the materials that are posted on this site.

Become an Open Participant!

Get involved by maintaining your own blog dedicated to XXXXandsubmit the URL to us using this form XXXX. After we verify your page, your blog will be syndicated to the main class page so you can participate in discussions.

Course Tags for all Students and Open Participants

The list below should be your starting point for tagging your content on your site. Required tags will be noted within each assignment. Feel free to create and add your own tags to posts. All of your Categories and Tags that you add to your posts will be converted to tags on the main course site. Help us keep the site organized by using tags on all posts.

Using Multiple Tags

Example of use: unit01, reflection,natural, competition, pressures, storms

Most common tags

  • unit## where ## is the relative unity number. Note that all unit numbers are 2 digits
  • reflection to denote reflections on your thoughts, ideas and experiences
  • bibliography for any literature you find, read or review related to this course

Descriptive tags

XXXX

Names

Scientific name, common name
